intro: Plectronia mabesae, commonly known as the Mabesae plectronia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves and showy, pentagonal flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
